content.webTitle: The week: Pause for thought | Quote of the week | Bionic threat | Share tactics | Good week for... | Bad week for...

fields.headline: The week
fields.bodyText: Pause for thought Last Friday customers were finally able to get their sticky paws on Apple's new iPhone. And therein lies a problem. The iPhone's slick touch screen isn't really sticky paw-friendly. Quote of the week 'They're a funny family [the Bancrofts], they couldn't decide who they wanted to nominate. We went through it, using a process of elimination, and we think she'll be a very fine director.' Rupert Murdoch on the appointment of 27-year-old opera singer Natalie Bancroft to his News Corporation board Bionic threat The pen is truly mightier than the sword. The writers' strike in the US is beginning to bite, with shows such as Bionic Woman under threat. If only it was Hollyoaks, rather than Hollywood, that was on strike... Share tactics ITV revealed last Wednesday that it wants BSkyB to sell its 17.9 per cent shareholding in the network. No suprises there. The result of this outburst? ITV's share price fell to an all-time low of 92.3p. Brilliant. Good week for... Virgin Media, which reported its strongest customer growth for a year - 13,000 new customers signed up. Now all Virgin has to do is... er... try to keep them. Bad week for... Blue Peter. Again. The Sun revealed that child actors had been roped in to quiz impressionist Jon Culshaw after a competition didn't bring in enough suitable children.
